item.title: Managing a Firewall with Firewalld
item.description: Understanding Linux Firewalling Firewalling is implemented in the Linux kernel by means of the netfilter subsystem to limit traffic coming in to a server or going out of the server. Netfilter allows kernel modules to inspect every incoming, outgoing, or forwarded packet and act upon it by either allowing it or blocking it. In essence, netfilter controls access to and from the network stack at the Linux kernel module level.
